ResourceHeader.Description:
Swarm is the fifth Earth Explorer mission approved in ESA's Living Planet Programme, 
        and was successfully launched on 22 November 2013. 
        
As part of the Third Party Missions programme, the e-POP instrument of the Canadian Space Agency's 
CASSIOPE mission joined the constellation in February 2018. 

The research objectives of the Swarm mission is to provide the best-ever survey of the geomagnetic 
field and its temporal evolution as well as the electric field in the atmosphere using a constellation of 
3 identical satellites - Swarm-A (Alpha), Swarm-B (Bravo), Swarm-C (Charlie) carrying sophisticated magnetometers and electric field instruments.
